page.title: 15VISITORS & EATING OUT
page.content: People are attracted to Ashwell by the old buildings and by the {medieval {graffitti} in the Church.They also come for meat and bread or to shop in the delicatessan. Two local pubs(the "{Bushel and {Strike"}and the{"Three Tuns"}have gained a good reputation for their restaurants.These{attract customers from all over North Herts.,though some people might say they were rather expensive and would only use them for a{special occasion}like a family celebration. A full meal in a restaurant like this costs around Â£12 - Â£15 a person.Wine or other drinks would add further to the price. Lighter,cheaper salad or "ploughman's" lunch (cheese or cold meat pie,bread & pickle) are popular at midday with visitors and businessmen.
